headings: Distinguished Alum Gifts Angelo State $1 Million for Academics, Nov 2
A Legacy of Lasting Impact, Oct 3
Want to learn more about the Honors Program?
paragraphs: The ASU Honors Program is designed to provide an enriched learning experience that will enhance the education of academically talented and motivated students.
Explore and expand your potential in the ASU Honors Program.

At the heart of the program is a learning community of capable and intellectually curious students who seek breadth and depth in their education and commit to becoming well-rounded students and citizens.

You will be challenged to delve deeper into your academic studies, develop your critical-thinking and analytical skills, and actively engage in university and community life. We offer a variety of courses, cultural events and community engagement activities designed to foster community and help you maximize your intellectual and personal talents.
Take advantage of programs and opportunities that are only available through the Honors Program.
Our curriculum complements your academic major to give you an educational experience that is second to none.
Get extra help during your freshman year as you adjust to college life as an honors student.
We offer opportunities for distinctive academic and cultural experiences that will change your life and prepare you for the future.
Engage with our campus student organization for honors students and represent the Honors Program in a variety of ways on campus and in the community.
We constantly find opportunities for honors students to compete for prestigious internships, fellowships, research programs and other opportunities at the local, regional and national levels.
Apr 30
Nov 2
The word “legacy” can mean many things in higher education.
Complete and submit ourRequest More Information Form.
Your gifts to the ASU Honors Program help support scholarships, undergraduate research, scholarly travel, academic programs, recruiting and much more.
To learn more about giving to the Honors Program, contact director Dr. Shirley Eoff atshirley.eoff@angelo.eduor 325-942-2722.

“The ASU Honors Program equipped me with the critical thinking and analytical skills necessary for success in my graduate studies and early career.”

Evelyn Burch Jones, Class of 2019, Political Science

“I have no doubt that the opportunities, writing/research skills, and community that Honors gave me lit my career path.”

P. Kate Creecy, Communications, Political Science, Class of 2021

“I am still reaping the benefits of the doors Honors opened for me years ago.”

Evelyn Burch Jones, Class of 2019, Political Science

“Even as a postgraduate student, I still get asked questions about my Honors experiences on my résumé because colleagues and potential employers recognize their value.”

P. Kate Creecy, Communications, Political Science, Class of 2021

“The rigorous coursework and thesis experience during my undergraduate education prepared me to succeed in my doctoral program.”

Nolan A. Sosa, B.B.A. (Management)/MBA, Class of 2017

“It’s really hard for undergraduates to get research opportunities at other universities. If you do research, often you can’t do other things. Whereas at ASU, they want you to do research; they want you to branch out; they want you to ask questions and push yourself.”

Hope Jenson, Biology, ROTC

“The Honors Program at Angelo State prepared me to succeed in law school.”

P. Kate Creecy, Communications, Political Science, Class of 2021

“As an Honors student, I gained access to resources and mentorship, research and travel opportunities, and, perhaps most importantly, a special perspective on what life and a career could look like beyond college.”

Evelyn Burch Jones, Class of 2019, Political Science

“The community I built while in the Honors Program remains a major part of my life and support network today.”

Tara Serio, Biology, Class of 2014

“Dr. Eoff backed every endeavor of mine, urging me to put forth my best effort and seize opportunities that broadened my horizons with diverse ideas and people.”

Christian Garcia, Finance and Accounting, Class of 2017

“I was in the Honors Program and completed two semesters of faculty-mentored, grant-funded independent research. One of those semesters of research, completed with Dr. Jackson in the English Department, resulted in a paper/project that was accepted to a national conference in Boston.”

Jodi Meyer, Class of 2018, Graduate/Research Assistant

“A lot of my opportunities have come through the ASU Honors Program. I participated in a fellowship through the Center for the Study of the Presidency and Congress. That was a really special opportunity. I also interned through ASU’s Political Science department in Texas District 11 Representative Conaway’s office in Washington D.C.”

Evelyn Burch Jones, Class of 2019, Political Science

“I decided to go to Angelo State because it was close to home, I’m able to keep in touch with my family and I also heard great things about the ROTC program and the Honors Program that I became a part of.”

Ravae Garcia, Biology, ROTC, Class of 2023

“Dr. Eoff’s encouragement was pivotal in bolstering my confidence in problem solving and execution. Through her support, I came to recognize my potential for innovation and leadership in entrepreneurship.”

Christian Garcia, Finance and Accounting, Class of 2017

“The Honors Program not only provided me with unique experiences within and beyond the classroom through engaging coursework and multiple internships but also fostered friendships and professional connections that have lasted a lifetime.”

Duncan Knox, History, Class of 2015
